snippet: Leaders of a House oversight committee leaders listed more than a dozen episodes, some violent, that they said formed the basis for repeated requests for more resources.
abstract: Republicans on the House oversight committee accuse officials in Washington of turning down repeated requests for increased security in Benghazi, Libya, before the September attack on the diplomatic compound there that killed Ambassador J Christopher Stevens and three other Americans; charge may be attempt by Republicans to portray Pres Barack Obama as weak on foreign policy.
lead_paragraph: Leaders of a House oversight committee leaders listed more than a dozen episodes, some violent, that they said formed the basis for repeated requests for more resources.

headline.seo: Diplomats’ Bids for More Security in Benghazi Turned Down, Republicans Say
headline.main: Added Security in Libya Was Rejected, G.O.P. Says
headline.print_headline: Added Security in Libya Was Rejected, G.O.P. Says
